intro: Aiouea brasiliensis var. glabriflora, commonly known as the Brazilian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink or red. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often glossy and elliptical in shape. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
